org.threadly.concurrent

Class TaskSchedulerDistributor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.KeyDistributedExecutor
      • org.threadly.concurrent.KeyDistributedScheduler
        • org.threadly.concurrent.TaskSchedulerDistributor
  • Deprecated. 
    use replacement at org.threadly.concurrent.KeyDistributedScheduler

    @Deprecated
public class TaskSchedulerDistributor
extends KeyDistributedScheduler

    This is a class which is more full featured than TaskExecutorDistributor, but it does require a scheduler implementation in order to be able to perform scheduling.

    The same guarantees and restrictions for the TaskExecutorDistributor also exist for this class. Please read the javadoc for TaskExecutorDistributor to understand more about how this operates.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructor to use a provided scheduler implementation for running tasks. This constructs with a default expected level of concurrency of 16. This also does not attempt to have an accurate queue size for the "getTaskQueueSize" call (thus preferring high performance).
        Parameters:
        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler,
                        boolean accurateQueueSize)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to specify if you want accurate queue sizes to be tracked for given thread keys. There is a performance hit associated with this, so this should only be enabled if "getTaskQueueSize" calls will be used. This constructs with a default expected level of concurrency of 16.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        accurateQueueSize - true to make "getTaskQueueSize" more accurate

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler,
                        int maxTasksPerCycle)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to provide a maximum number of tasks for a key before it yields to another key. This can make it more fair, and make it so no single key can starve other keys from running. The lower this is set however, the less efficient it becomes in part because it has to give up the thread and get it again, but also because it must copy the subset of the task queue which it can run. This also allows you to specify if you want accurate queue sizes to be tracked for given thread keys. There is a performance hit associated with this, so this should only be enabled if "getTaskQueueSize" calls will be used. This constructs with a default expected level of concurrency of 16. This also does not attempt to have an accurate queue size for the "getTaskQueueSize" call (thus preferring high performance).
        Parameters:
        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        maxTasksPerCycle - maximum tasks run per key before yielding for other keys

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler,
                        int maxTasksPerCycle,
                        boolean accurateQueueSize)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to provide a maximum number of tasks for a key before it yields to another key. This can make it more fair, and make it so no single key can starve other keys from running. The lower this is set however, the less efficient it becomes in part because it has to give up the thread and get it again, but also because it must copy the subset of the task queue which it can run. This also allows you to specify if you want accurate queue sizes to be tracked for given thread keys. There is a performance hit associated with this, so this should only be enabled if "getTaskQueueSize" calls will be used. This constructs with a default expected level of concurrency of 16.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        maxTasksPerCycle - maximum tasks run per key before yielding for other keys
        accurateQueueSize - true to make "getTaskQueueSize" more accurate

        expectedParallism - level of expected quantity of threads adding tasks in parallel
        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(int expectedParallism,

        Deprecated. 
        Constructor to use a provided scheduler implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to provide a maximum number of tasks for a key before it yields to another key. This can make it more fair, and make it so no single key can starve other keys from running. The lower this is set however, the less efficient it becomes in part because it has to give up the thread and get it again, but also because it must copy the subset of the task queue which it can run. This constructor does not attempt to have an accurate queue size for the "getTaskQueueSize" call (thus preferring high performance).

        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(int expectedParallism,
                        SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler,
                        int maxTasksPerCycle,
                        boolean accurateQueueSize)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructor to use a provided scheduler implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to provide a maximum number of tasks for a key before it yields to another key. This can make it more fair, and make it so no single key can starve other keys from running. The lower this is set however, the less efficient it becomes in part because it has to give up the thread and get it again, but also because it must copy the subset of the task queue which it can run. This also allows you to specify if you want accurate queue sizes to be tracked for given thread keys. There is a performance hit associated with this, so this should only be enabled if "getTaskQueueSize" calls will be used.
        Parameters:
        expectedParallism - level of expected quantity of threads adding tasks in parallel
        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        maxTasksPerCycle - maximum tasks run per key before yielding for other keys
        accurateQueueSize - true to make "getTaskQueueSize" more accurate
